content.question: Which of the following is commonly identified as a failure of the Articles of Confederation?

choices.label: The national government lacked an effective power to raise revenue.
The executive branch was granted too much power over the legislature.
The federal government had too much control over interstate commerce.
The judicial branch was elected and did not consistently adhere to rule of law.

content.answer: The national government lacked an effective power to raise revenue.

topic.text: 1.4: Challenges of the Articles of Confederation

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
